Link Mash (July 10, 2014)

Jul 10, 2014
1 minute read

The weekly Link Mash is a curated selection of tools, stories, and other links that I found during my travels on the web. All of my links can be found on my Pinboard; you can also find the Link Mash archives here.

  • harelba/q. A CLI that provides SQL-esque querying abilities on delimited text files. Cool!
  • aria2. Another wget/cURL alternative worth examining.
  • Paw – The missing HTTP & REST API Tester for Mac. I’ve long wanted an OS X equivalent to Fiddler (an amazing HTTP call testing application). This one just might do the trick.
  • sdegutis/hydra. An interesting window management system for OS X. Worth a look.

This Link Mash was generated by PinPress, a simple tool to generate text templates from Pinboard data.

Theme crafted with <3 by John Otander (@4lpine).
